Articles.Content: I think it would be very helpful if in action groups you could have timers, so a parachute on a booster rocket could deploy several seconds after it is jettisoned, or other similar uses.

This would be handy for me too. I have a rocket design I use a lot in which there's a Saturn V - styled escape tower for the capsule in case something goes wrong on the launchpad. I hit the abort action group and the tower takes off. And then I hit a second (ALT-1) action group later to do the parachutes. It would make sense to just have that be under one button: decouple, fire, wait 15 seconds, parachutes.

As it is right now, when it comes time to get rid of the escape tower because the early stage of the launch is over and its now on the 2nd or 3rd stage on the way up, I can't hit a single stage to jettison the tower because if I activate its engines at the same time as I decouple it, the decoupling seems to happen "first" even though they're in the same stage, and that makes the engines then unresponsive since they're no longer attached to the main command module, so the second half of the stages' instructions - to activate the engines on the tower, never executes. Then the tower just sits there being disconnected but still jammed into the nose of the rocket anyway because the rocket is still accelerating.
Oh, sorry, I didn't search for other suggestions, I just checked in the do not suggest list and list of planned features. My bad.

Dig that.

But as I see now there is no way to save your droped boosters right now.
